SYNIP0007_syn_1:
Indication: Bilateral RMS/LMS anastomotic strictures (Lung Tx).
Procedure: Flex Bronch + Bilateral Stents.
Anesthesia: GA.
Intervention:
- RMS: Dilated, 12x30mm metal stent (31636).
- LMS: Dilated, 12x30mm metal stent (31637).
Result: Bilateral patency restored.
Plan: ICU.
SYNIP0007_syn_2:
INDICATION: Bilateral mainstem bronchial stenosis following bilateral lung transplantation.
PROCEDURE: The patient was placed under general anesthesia. Bronchoscopy revealed significant strictures at both the right and left anastomoses. Both sites were dilated via balloon. A 12 x 30 mm metallic stent was deployed in the right mainstem bronchus (Initial). A second 12 x 30 mm metallic stent was deployed in the left mainstem bronchus (Additional). Fluoroscopy confirmed symmetric expansion and proper placement of both prostheses.
DISPOSITION: The patient was transferred to the CT-ICU.
SYNIP0007_syn_3:
Codes:
- 31636: Stent, initial bronchus (Right Mainstem).
- 31637: Stent, additional bronchus (Left Mainstem).
Rationale: Patient required stenting of two separate major bronchi (bilateral mainstems) for anastomotic strictures. Dilation included.
SYNIP0007_syn_4:
Procedure: Bilateral Stents
Patient: [REDACTED]
Steps:
1. GA.
2. Saw narrowing in both RMS and LMS.
3. Dilated both sides.
4. Put 12x30 metal stent in Right.
5. Put 12x30 metal stent in Left.
6. Both look open.
No complications.
SYNIP0007_syn_5: Sarah Jenkins here for bilateral airway narrowing after her transplant. We dilated both sides then put metal stents in. Right side got a 12 by 30. Left side also got a 12 by 30. Both airways are wide open now. Minimal bleeding. Sending her to ICU.
SYNIP0007_syn_6: INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT Patient: [REDACTED] 55/F Date: [REDACTED] Indication: Bilateral bronchial anastomotic strictures after bilateral lung transplant with exertional dyspnea. Procedure: Flexible bronchoscopy with balloon dilation and bilateral bronchial stent placement (right and left mainstem). Anesthesia: General anesthesia with ETT; anesthesia team present. Findings: Approximately 60–70% concentric narrowing at both right and left mainstem bronchial anastomoses; no mass; mild mucus plugging. Intervention: Balloon dilation to 10 and 12 mm was performed at each anastomosis. A 12 x 30 mm metallic stent was deployed in the right mainstem (initial bronchus), followed by placement of a 12 x 30 mm metallic stent in the left mainstem as an additional major bronchus. Final lumen on both sides showed <20% residual narrowing with symmetric ventilation. Complications: Minimal bleeding; no hypoxia. Disposition: Extubated in OR and admitted to cardiothoracic ICU.
SYNIP0007_syn_7:
[Indication]
Bilateral anastomotic strictures.
[Anesthesia]
General.
[Description]
RMS and LMS dilated. 12x30mm metallic stent placed in RMS. 12x30mm metallic stent placed in LMS. Bilateral patency achieved.
[Plan]
ICU. Surveillance bronch 4 weeks.
SYNIP0007_syn_8: [REDACTED] in both of her main airways from her transplant. We fixed both sides today. We used balloons to stretch the narrow spots and then placed id[REDACTED] metal stents in the right and left main airways. Everything looks symmetrical and open now.
SYNIP0007_syn_9:
Indication: Bilateral bronchial anastomotic constrictions after bilateral lung transplant.
Procedure: Flexible bronchoscopy with balloon expansion and bilateral bronchial stent insertion.
Intervention: Balloon expansion was performed at each anastomosis. A 12 x 30 mm metallic stent was installed in the right mainstem, followed by insertion of a 12 x 30 mm metallic stent in the left mainstem. Final lumen on both sides showed <20% residual narrowing.
SYNIP0007:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT
Patient: [REDACTED]  MRN: [REDACTED]  Age/Sex: 55/F
Date: [REDACTED]
Indication: Bilateral bronchial anastomotic strictures after bilateral lung transplant with exertional dyspnea.
Procedure: Flexible bronchoscopy with balloon dilation and bilateral bronchial stent placement (right and left mainstem).
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with ETT; anesthesia team present.
Findings: Approximately 60–70% concentric narrowing at both right and left mainstem bronchial anastomoses; no mass; mild mucus plugging.
Intervention: Balloon dilation to 10 and 12 mm was performed at each anastomosis. A 12 x 30 mm metallic stent was deployed in the right mainstem (initial bronchus), followed by placement of a 12 x 30 mm metallic stent in the left mainstem as an additional major bronchus. Final lumen on both sides showed <20% residual narrowing with symmetric ventilation.
Complications: Minimal bleeding; no hypoxia.
Disposition: Extubated in OR and admitted to cardiothoracic ICU.
